info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 9:20PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...TREACHEROUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS CONTINUE THROUGH MIDNIGHT... WEATHER... * Periods of heavy, wet snowfall will continue through midnight between the I-94 corridor and I-69 corridor, as well as stretching up into portions of the Thumb as bands of snowfall become focused in this region. Treacherous travel conditions will continue on all roadways, whether treated or untreated. * Hourly snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will continue to be common, with localized areas seeing hourly snowfall rates potentially approaching 3 inches per hour. Additionally, thundersnow will be possible along with sporadic lightning strikes. Numerous reports of thundersnow and lightning have already been reported. * Additional quick heavy, wet snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches will be possible through midnight, with locally higher amounts possible. Higher totals will be possible where concentrated bands of heavier snow set up, primarily between M-59 and I-69 and into portions of the eastern Thumb. * Air temperatures will generally hover around the freezing mark. Despite air temperatures around freezing, rapid snowfall accumulation will allow for very efficient accumulation on area roadways. * Widespread visibilities below 1/2 mile will continue to be common through midnight, due to gusty northeast winds as high as 35 mph at times. Blowing snow will be minimal due to the wet character of the snow, but downed limbs and trees that have already experienced heavy load from the recent ice storm may lead to increased hazards on area roadways as well as power outages. IMPACTS... * Treacherous winter weather conditions are likely due to the combination of heavy accumulating snow, near whiteout conditions at times, and gusty winds up to 35 mph at times. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Treacherous travel conditions remain likely. Travel is not advised. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
